Famous Landmarks.name: Architectural Wonders & Artistic Havens
Famous Landmarks.description: Test your knowledge of iconic buildings and museums around the globe. From Frank Lloyd Wright's masterpieces to the halls of the Louvre, this quiz explores the world's most celebrated landmarks.

questions.text: Where is the Louvre museum?
questions.hint: This museum is in a European capital along the Seine River.

questions.text: Where is the Louvre museum?
questions.hint: This museum is in a European capital along the Seine River.

questions.text: Where is the Frank Lloyd Wright-designed house known as Falling Water?
questions.hint: This architectural masterpiece is in a state known for its steel industry.

questions.text: Where is Ghirardelli Square located?
questions.hint: This square is in a California city famous for its chocolate and cable cars.

Famous Landmarks.name: Symbols of Freedom & Cinematic Climbs
Famous Landmarks.description: Explore the landmarks that define nations and grace the silver screen. This quiz delves into American icons and the dramatic moments they've witnessed, from flags to film.

questions.text: How many stars are on the American flag?
questions.hint: The number of stars corresponds to the number of states in the U.S.

questions.text: In the 1976 remake of the classic film 'King Kong' what New York landmark does the giant ape climb?
questions.hint: This was a modern skyscraper in New York at the time, unlike the original film's setting.

questions.text: How many spikes are on the Statue of Liberty's crown?
questions.hint: The number of spikes symbolizes the seven continents or seas.
